subject: World Cup (Skiing)
lead_paragraph: With heavy snow hampering visibility, Marc Gini of Switzerland won a slalom in Reiteralm, Austria, for his first World Cup victory. Bode Miller of the United States, competing independently, was 26th. Miller, who hit his chin on a gate in the first run, came to a near standstill and almost missed a gate in his final run. The top American was Jimmy Cochran, who was 14th.
